1.str2: The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
A tribe or race of people. From phuo; an offshoot, i.e. Race or clan.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaspeiro; dispersion, i.e. the Israelite resident in Gentile countries.
A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: From peri and pipto; to fall into something that is all around, i.e. Light among or upon, be surrounded with.
From peirazo; a putting to proof (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A test, trial, what is genuine. Neuter of a presumed derivative of dokime; a testing; by implication, trustworthiness.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: From kata and ergazomai; to work fully, i.e. Accomplish; by implication, to finish, fashion.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.

4.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

4.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
4.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Complete in every part, sound, perfect, entire. From holos and kleros; complete in every part, i.e. Perfectly sound.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
4.str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.

5.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

5.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
5.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
5.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.

5.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
5.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Simply, sincerely, graciously, bountifully. Adverb from haplous; bountifully.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
5.str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.

5.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

6.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

6.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
6.str2: From dia and krino; to separate thoroughly, i.e. to withdraw from, or oppose; figuratively, to discriminate, or hesitate.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
6.str2: From dia and krino; to separate thoroughly, i.e. to withdraw from, or oppose; figuratively, to discriminate, or hesitate.

6.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: To be like, resemble. Apparently a primary verb; to resemble.
Rough water, a wave, billow, surge. From kluzo; a surge of the sea.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
6.str2: To be blown with the wind (referring to the gentler motions of the air). From anemos; to toss with the wind.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
6.str2: To toss to and fro, fan, blow. From a derivative of rhipto; to breeze up, i.e. to agitate.

7.str2: That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

7.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: To think, suppose, expect, imagine. Or oimai middle voice apparently from hoios; to make like, i.e. Imagine.

7.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

7.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
7.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

8.str2: (lit: of two souls, of two selves), double-minded, wavering. From dis and psuche; two-spirited, i.e. Vacillating.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Unsettled, unstable (though these are hardly strong enough equivalents), almost anarchic. Inconstant.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

9.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Humble, lowly, in position or spirit (in a good sense). Of uncertain derivation; depressed, i.e. humiliated.

9.str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

9.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
9.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.

Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Bloom, possibly a reference to the bright flowers, such as poppies (among the grass). A primary word; a blossom.
Grass, herbage, growing grain, hay. Apparently a primary word; a 'court' or 'garden', i.e. herbage or vegetation.

11.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

11.str2: To make to rise, I rise, shine (generally of the sun, and hence met.). From ana and the base of telos; to arise.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
A scorching heat, hot wind. From kausoo; a glare.
And, even, also, namely.

11.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: To dry up, parch, be ripened, wither, waste away. From xeros; to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature.

Grass, herbage, growing grain, hay. Apparently a primary word; a 'court' or 'garden', i.e. herbage or vegetation.

And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Beauty, gracefulness, comeliness. From a compound of eu and prepo; good suitableness, i.e. Gracefulness.

11.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.

11.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

A journey, pursuit, undertaking, progress. From poreuomai; travel; figuratively proceedings, i.e. Career.

12.str2: Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

12.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular

12.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

12.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
12.str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

12.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Untried, inexperienced, untempted, incapable of being tempted. Untried, i.e. Not temptable.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

13.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
13.str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.

Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
